Articles.Content: On a clean install with *just* Kopernicus and some Planet Pack that is confirmed working for many people? If it does not work there, what does your log say? Last time I checked, Kopernicus was pretty vocal with regards to logging stuff...

On a clean install with *just* Kopernicus and some Planet Pack that is confirmed working for many people? If it does not work there, what does your log say? Last time I checked, Kopernicus was pretty vocal with regards to logging stuff...

It was b.c. I was missing some textures, fixed it!

Now I have SpaceEngine so I'm gonna romp around for textures.

Who would have thought that

Glad you got it worked out!
Lavinia dev thread is open! http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/108733-Kopernicus-Core-Lavinia-Expansion?p=1697653#post1697653

Can somebody put up a download for a config file for both the Stella expansion and the Odysseus expansion in one? i don't know how to merge them.... i dont know how to work with config files, but im just starting to learn...

Can somebody put up a download for a config file for both the Stella expansion and the Odysseus expansion in one? i don't know how to merge them.... i dont know how to work with config files, but im just starting to learn...

Just download the Core and Stella first, and then download Odyssseus. ONLY paste the Kopernicus parts from Odysseus into your GameData, and then everything should work.

It's really not hard.

Just download the Core and Stella first, and then download Odyssseus. ONLY paste the Kopernicus parts from Odysseus into your GameData, and then everything should work.

It's really not hard.

You Don't understand... Stella (beautiful pack btw) wont work at all for me, i'm installing it the same way i install Odysseus but it wont work wether i have Odysseus installed or not.

Ok, so I took the Stella config and merged it with the Odysseus config. I'm not sure, but I think if you take all of this and paste it into the main System config it'll work.

	Body
    {
        name = Odysseus
        flightGlobalsIndex = 750
        Template
        {
            name = Jool
        }
        Properties
        {
            description = Known as being that "yellow dot in the night sky," Odysseus is a yellow gas giant just smaller than Jool with an assortment of unique moons.

            radius = 5000000

            mass = 2.4498052595297E+24

            geeASL = 0.66666668375
        }
        Orbit

            referenceBody = Sun

	Body
    {
        name = Antinous
        flightGlobalsIndex = 755
        Template
        {
            name = Dres
        }
        Properties
        {
            description = Antinous is the home of staggering mountains and steep cliffs on a magnitude unlike anywhere else in the solar system. Upon discovery of this asteroid, some shady astronomers claimed that Antinous was an exact copy of Gilly. When asked how they drew this conclusion, the astronomers quickly bolted out of the building. They have yet to be located.

            radius = 21000

            mass = 4.3471792e+15

            geeASL = 0.05875001513

        Orbit

	Body
    {
        name = Penelope
        flightGlobalsIndex = 752
        Template
        {
            name = Laythe
        }
        Properties
        {
            description = Scientists believe that Penelope formed much in the way that Laythe did, and that the reason liquid water exists here is due to tidal heating between Odysseus and the moon. Yet this didn't stop the public from drawing their own conclusion; Laythe and Penelope were once sisters and one day had a big fight, thus resulting in Penelope running away and living with Odysseus. Scientists have claimed that, however, celestial bodies are not sentient. The controversy rages to this day.

            radius = 500000

            mass = 4.6290736411285E+20

            geeASL = 0.86400002523
        }
        Orbit

Ok, so I took the Stella config and merged it with the Odysseus config. I'm not sure, but I think if you take all of this and paste it into the main System config it'll work.

I've decided to start making a planet pack. It's going to be more gameplay focused as opposed to realism focused - the planets will be realistic themselves, but not analogous to anything in our solar system.

Anyway I have two planets so far. One is a high gravity desert planet with a thin atmosphere. As far as I can tell that's working great. The other is a Titan-like planet with low gravity and thick atmosphere. On that planet, it appears that the height map and the color map in game are not lining up at all, although the textures line up perfectly. I think that the two maps in game differ by 90 degrees or 180 degrees but I'm not sure. It's certainly not just a little bit off. The scaled space matches the color map texture. Is there any good way of going about fixing that? Or should I cut/paste my height texture so that they line up?

___________________              _______ ___________
|                  |                   | |

No it doesnt. I've built a nuclear ship, which can go this far, I even have youtube video about that (I can give you a link, if you want). But this was based on PF:CE, which had a faster time acceleration. The trip takes 200 years, which is ludicrously long even at max time acceleratioin. I've even put a ship on an encounter with Stella, but than I realized I have no time to wait until it gets there. So, the warp drive is actually reasonable solution. Besides, will you use any orbital sublight engine, if you can use somehing faster?

P.S. At first, I was thinking, it's cheaty, too. But, when I've started to mess up with warp mechanics in KSPI, I realized, that no matter, how easy it is to launch, it can be a real puzzle for you.

Ok, the Stella/Odysseus planet pack JID00Gaming requested is done. All you have to do is click and drag the contents into the GameData folder. TIP: Just to be safe, I'd install a fresh copy of Kopernicus. Also, this took me several minutes to load.

https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/548/Stella%20and%20Odysseus%20Planet%20Pack?new=True
just saw my request on kerbalstuff... Thanks to whoever did that...

By the way, RSS can change the time warp rates. For packs that add far away planets and stars, just put this in RealSolarSystemSettings.cfg

timeWarpRates

{

rate1 = 10

rate2 = 100

rate3 = 1000

rate4 = 10000

rate5 = 100000

rate6 = 1000000

rate7 = 10000000

}

Or something to that effect. By removing the 5x and 50x, you now have a max warp 100 times stock max speed. Also, the mod Time Control can change warp rates both in phys-warp and on rails.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/69363-0-25-Time-Control-9-23-14-v13-2

Unrelated to that, here are two planets I have been working on.

Ixium is sort of like Titan, with thick atmosphere and low gravity. This is the planet whose heightmap and color map don't line up. Anyone have this problem and know why?

Cantor bridges the difficulty gap between Tylo and Eve. It has a gravity of 1.4 g and an atmosphere of 0.6 atm.

I am planning on adding more planets to the pack, but as these are the most difficult I decided to work on them first. I will also add a largeish non-atmospheric moon, some small asteroid moons, and maybe a gas giant for Ixium to orbit.

Whats the template used to calculate radius and mass of your planets etc?

Whats the template used to calculate radius and mass of your planets etc?

The template is whatever stock planet you set your custom planet to. Here's how I'd do the mass: if your planet is 700 km. in radius and has a template of Laythe, then you'd take the radius of Laythe (500 km.) and multiply it by how large your custom planet is. 700/500= 1.4. Now, take the mass of your custom planet's template (in this case, Laythe has a mass of 2.9397663E22) and multiply it by that last number we calculated (which was 1.4). Here we would do 1.4*2.9397663E22= 4.11567282E22. 4.11567282E22 would be your mass!

Of course, you don't have to it do this way. Just inputting any numbers you see fit will work just fine.
